name: Yocada Carpet Sweeper Cleaner for Home Office Low Carpets Rugs Undercoat Carpets Pet Hair Dust Scraps Paper Small Rubbish Cleaning with a Brush Purple
about_this_item: Carpet Sweeper MULTIFUNCTIONAL: Safe and efficient on low carpets, rugs, undercoat carpets. Please DON'T use it on floors like hardwood, ceramic, tile, laminate, marble or glass. It only works best on carpets
Carpet Sweeper GOOD COLLECTING: For pet hair, bread crumbs, dust, debris, paper clips and etc
Carpet Sweeper NO BATTERIESÔºöNo electricity needed and no messy cords to deal with
Carpet Sweeper NO DUST PAN: There is no dustpan to deal with. You can easily empty the garbage by pressing the button on the sweeper
The size of our carpet sweeper: The height is about 42.52 inch, and the size of the sweeper is about 11inch(L) 7.87inch(W) 2.76inch(H)

title: Just what I was looking for
content: It is a great sweeper. It works as expected and is what I was looking for. The color is nice as well. It is compact and easy to store. A good sweeper for the price!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I am a huge reader of reviews... most of the time I buy a product bc it has been highly recommended by the majority....so I bought this sweeper for a rug from hell ....it is rubber backing with grey strips of carpet...for the kitchen...had to drag up the vacuum just to keep it clean....this sweeper picked up everything from this rug...I have never owned a sweeper until now...if you prefer the easy way as I do...this is a quick resolve for quick and easy clean...no cords, no noise, and it picks up everything that even my vacuum wouldn't....MUST HAVE!

title: Hard to empty
content: It picks up the pet hair off the throw rugs, but only on the "push". Not on the "pull." And it's hard to push. Works well enough for quick pickups between vacuuming, but probably spend a little more and get a better product.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: This is well made, lots of real metal not cheap plastic. I expect it will last. It works exceptionally well. Not only picks up the little specs I saw on the carpet like tiny little rips of paper, tiny little rocks/stones/sand, etc. but also picks up stuff I didn't even see or notice until I went to empty it into the garbage. Seems to pull dust and cat hair right out of the carpet. Besides working great, it also did not scare my cat like the regular vacuum does, which is a huge plus because it breaks my heart everytime I need to use the regular vacuum and my cat gets all low and scurries into the bedroom to hide under the bed all scared. Highly recommend.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2024

title: Middle Rotor Pops Out Instantly For Me?
content: I bought this carpet sweeper to use on days that I don't feel like dragging out the vacuum cleaner. I think it works great. It is easy to assemble, and I used it immediately. Some reviewers said that the handle comes apart. I check to be sure the handle is secure before I begin using it and, so far, only once have I needed to tighten one section of the handle just a little bit. It does a good job. Of course, not as good as a vacuum cleaner, which I was aware of when I ordered this item, but my carpets look clean after I use my carpet sweeper. I still use the vacuum cleaner, but not as often. This carpet sweeper makes cleaning easier. It's an easy gadget to use, and I recommend it.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2024

title: Works well on carpet
content: The Yocada Carpet Sweeper Cleaner works great on my rugs. I use this sweeper in my basement carpet beside my sewing area. I usually make a tiny fabric piece and thread mess. I would usually clean this carpet with a sweeper/power head. Unfortunately. I only own one sweeper/power head  which I keep in the upstairs. So after carting my sweeper/power head up and down the stairs I decided to purchase the Yocada Carpet Sweeper. It works great on my rug. I now have the rug swept faster than I can plug my sweeper/power head into the wall socket. I am so glad I purchased this. I also like the company Yocada, I have purchased other cleaning items that work well.

title: Awesome carpet sweeper!
content: I teach kindergarten. They are messy little people. I needed something that would be a quick solution to daily spills. I bought this without high hopes. My previous one by another well known manufacturer wasn't the greatest and I ended up tossing it. I LOVE this handy little machine. It picks up paper scraps, snack wrappers, grass clippings, wood chips, fallen leaves and even orbeez with ease.  My students love to use it and request daily to be the sweeper helper. (gotta love that!!) I highly recommend this if you have the industrial kind of carpet they put in schools and public spaces. It does a great job.

title: Verified Purchase
content: The only little glitch so far, is the hard time I have had opening the area where crumbs & hair are collected. There are two dirt compartments, I put a dab of nail polish on one underside so it would be easy to know which side had been emptied. At this point, am very pleased. Great tool!  PS: as product info. says, this is for rugs only, get a dual purpose machine if you need to do rugs AND bare floors.

title: Worth every penny
content: I ordered this Yorcada carpet sweeper as well as the Fuller Bursh carpet sweeper. Thie Yorcada weeper was 1/3 the price of the Fuller Brush. I compared the internal construction, quality of the parts, ability to pick up on a short weave carpet that we have as well as on ceramic tile. Neither sweeper was designed to pick up on hard floors such as ceramic tile. BOTH sweepers had IDENTICAL internal construction and parts. The fuller Brush sweeper was a little smaller than the Yorcada. The fuller Brush seemed to have trouble picking anything up on our short weave carpet whereas the Yorcada picked up everything. PLUS the Yorcada even picked up food particles and other loose small bits on the ceramic tile. The Yorcada has a little more inconvenient mechanism for opening the collection bins on the sweeper bottom. But once you figure it out it's not a big deal. I have been using the Yorcada every other day or so now for about 3 weeks and it works great. I returned the expensive Fuller Brush one. I am a retired man with a disabled wife and I do all the chores. I am very pleased with the Yorcada.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2022

title: Verified Purchase
content: I love it

title: Surprise
content: I used this occasionally over the last few years to clean cat hair from my carpet when I didn't want to get out the vacuum.  It does well at this.  So well, that the small front and back rollers (they pick up hair, not dirt) hold onto the cat hair so well it is nearly impossible to get it off again.  The large middle roller does a good job of picking up small bits of dirt and debris.  Warning, it picks debris up only moving in one direction, not the reverse direction.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: This is the first time I have used a carpet sweeper as an adult.  This one is definitely not as sturdy (or as heavy) as the metal one that my mother had decades ago, but it does the job.  I am fostering four timid cats who leave fur, bits of dry food, carpet tufts from the scratching post, and general dust on the carpet.  A vacuum cleaner would frighten them, and those expensive vacuum cleaner bags would fill quickly.  This sweeper gets it, without electricity or vacuum cleaner bags, and the dust collection bins are easy to empty.  I am very pleased with this purchase.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
